page.title: 12Thornton village
page.content: Thornton is set on a hill. It lies between Bell Dean and Pinch Beck valleys. It is surrounded by countryside but in the centre of Thornton it is usually very busy. On Market Street there is a house where the Brontes were born. We have a viaduct and from Hill Top there is a good view of it. There used to be a train track on there but it is no longer in use. A lot of the streets are still cobbled and you are always having to walk up hills. There are 3 schools in Thornton, 2 first schools and a middle school. The middle school site used to be a railway station but then they turned it into a school.A lot of the houses are old but parts of Thornton are very new. Near St James' church there are some council houses that were built just after the second world war.
